intro: Melissitus archiducis-nicolai, commonly known as the Nicolai's honeybee plant, is a flowering species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicately endangered species.
